titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the photograph album depicting members of the Umatilla people

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-14.

langusage.language: Finding aid is written in English.

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

did.unittitle: Photograph album depicting members of the Umatilla people
did.abstract: Small leather-bound album containing black and white portraits, taken by an unknown photographer, of unidentified members of the Umatilla people, particularly women and children.

acqinfo.p: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. John B. Robinson, December 1984 (Lib. Acc. 17090, Photo Acc. 985D039).

prefercite.p: Photograph album depicting members of the Umatilla people, Org. Lot 335, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

processinfo.p: The album was also designated as Album 764 by the Oregon Historical Society Research Library. This collection was titled "J. R. Robinson photographic collection on Umatilla Indians" prior to February 2024.

scopecontent.p: Small leather-bound album containing black and white portraits of unidentified members of the Umatilla people, particularly women and children, circa 1910, as well as one photograph of a tipi. The cover of the album is decorated with a drawing of a tipi among trees. The photographer is unidentified.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society owns the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use may require seeking additional authorization from copyright owners.
